name: places/ChIJ9e4KttRZwokRPikSJFlccnM
adrFormatAddress: 765 8th Ave, New York, NY 10036-7005, USA

originalText.text:
This is a horrible hotel.  No elevator, we were given the wrong room and keys twice and walked in on people after lugging suitcases up 5 flights of steep stairs.  The room was advertised as a king, but it was a full size bed and so small, I couldn’t fully open my suitcase on the floor!  The bed was  pushed against the two walls, so you could only walk around one side of the bed and the floor space was so tight only one person at a time could fit!  After 1 hour of checking in we left and went and found a different hotel. Do not stay at this hotel!

Also our room window was wide open when we entered and a fire escape was right outside the open window in a back alley.  It didn’t feel safe for me and my daughter.

originalText.text:
My recent 6-day stay at this hotel was a letdown in several aspects. When I arrived and booked my stay in person, I was not informed about the inoperative TVs in the rooms. This lack of communication was frustrating as it left me without a basic amenity that I had expected.

Adding to my dissatisfaction was the room cleaning situation. After waiting for 3 days, I inquired about the cleaning process, only to learn that it was on request. Upon requesting the cleaning, I was assured it would be taken care of. However, even after making the request, my room was left uncleaned for another day.

The fact that the hotel failed to communicate about the TV issue and chose not to inform me during booking was disappointing and demonstrated a lack of consideration for guests. Similarly, the delayed cleaning despite my explicit request highlighted the hotel's poor service execution. Overall, my experience at this hotel was marked by unaddressed concerns and subpar service.

originalText.text:
Tricksters, I booked a room on Aug 5, 2023 with double bunk bed. When we reached the hotel, the front desk lady informs us we only have single bunk bed throughout in the hotel. Luxurban their online booking partner is having wrong information and it happened before to a family who had faced the same issue. Even after that they didn't correct the mistake and willing to pay back half the amount. We accepted and stayed. Meanwhile I requested for a confirmation email saying they will refund but I never received the email or the money until now. Do not believe this people, beware.
Location: Great
Room: not spacious even for two people to walk
Bathroom: toilet is not flushing, we complained but no response.

originalText.text:
This place is the REAL DEAL!  Wow!

This was one of the cheapest hotel rooms in all of NYC (not just Manhattan) and is literally right in the middle of it all. Right on 8th Ave, between 46th and 47th St, you couldn’t be closer to the excitement of midtown. One block from Times Square and Broadway, only a couple short blocks to the nearest subway, less than 10 minute walk to Central Park, you can get anywhere fast.

This hotel recently came under new ownership/management, which may explain some of the bad reviews. The front desk staff were super friendly throughout the stay and even let me check in early.

My room was small (obviously, for what you’re paying in this location) but it was clean and the bathroom had recently been updated to nice tile and a rain shower head. And the water was super hot! The room stayed nice and cool with a great air conditioner unit. There was a tv in the room but it’s NYC so I never turned it on (I assume it worked?).  I should point out that I was traveling solo, so a small room isn’t an issue.

It’s true that this hotel does not have an elevator but that wasn’t a problem for me at all.

I also have to mention that my room was nice and quiet. This building is on the interior of the block so virtually no rooms face the street. This is HUGE in midtown where bar crowds, traffic, and sirens can sometimes keep you up all night. I slept like a baby!  (Of course, it being an interior block building meant I didn’t have a window, which was actually totally awesome. I slept in so late! But if you need a window for some reason, most rooms in this hotel probably don’t have one).

This is the bare-bones hotel you’ve been looking for in Manhattan. I would book it again in a heartbeat.

For a solo traveler, or a couple traveling on a budget: service, location, and room were all five stars.

originalText.text:
Giving this place a good rating because, for its price and location, it is worth it. My partner and I stayed there for 7 nights and we were happy to walk the 5 flights of stairs to our room to walk off some of the calories gained from the amazing food around the area.

You pay what you get for! So don't have high expectations. Our room was really clean and the bed was big and comfortable.

The door to the bathroom however wouldn't close properly which was annoying.

Not the best service, but it is New York, so you shouldn't expect good service even at a 5 star place.

Summary: I'd stay again as the location is AMAZING. A walk to literally everything with the world at your doorstep. Bed was comfortable and the toilet worked, that's all we needed.
